docs.snippet: THE new-reign set of the British colony of St. Lucia in the West Indies reached New York last week. Unusually attractive in appearance, it gives philatelists several views not used on the island's stamps in the past.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE new-reign set of the British colony of St. Lucia in the West Indies reached New York last week. Unusually attractive in appearance, it gives philatelists several views not used on the island's stamps in the past.

docs.snippet: Last Summer Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh, interrupting his medical research, left his home on the Island of St. Gildas off the French coast for an aerial tour of Europe. Mrs. Lindbergh went with him. They flew to Moscow, where, warmly welcomed by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Last Summer Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh, interrupting his medical research, left his home on the Island of St. Gildas off the French coast for an aerial tour of Europe. Mrs. Lindbergh went with him. They flew to Moscow, where, warmly welcomed by the Russians, they saw the annual Aviation Day demonstration of Soviet flying.

headline.main: ABROAD; Lindbergh Attack Table Talk Cardinal Innitzer Pan-American Peace

docs.snippet: Captain William Bruce Oakley will command the American Republic's liner Uruguay when she sails Saturday in the fortnightly service of the "Good Neighbor Fleet" to Rio de Janeiro, Santos, Montevideo and Buenos Aires, it was announced yesterday by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Captain William Bruce Oakley will command the American Republic's liner Uruguay when she sails Saturday in the fortnightly service of the "Good Neighbor Fleet" to Rio de Janeiro, Santos, Montevideo and Buenos Aires, it was announced yesterday by the United States Maritime Commission.
docs.abstract: Capt W B Oakley to command SS Uruguay on good-will trip

headline.main: To Command the Uruguay On Her Good-Will Trip

docs.snippet: President Roosevelt inn message today to Dr. Manuel Maria Borrero, President of Ecuador, declared the readiness of the United States Government to participate with other American governments that have been approached by Ecuador in an effort to...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Roosevelt inn message today to Dr. Manuel Maria Borrero, President of Ecuador, declared the readiness of the United States Government to participate with other American governments that have been approached by Ecuador in an effort to mediate the long-standing boundary dispute between Ecuador and Peru, provided Peru was also agreeable to the proposal.
docs.abstract: Roosevelt replies to Borrero; says U S will participate in mediation

docs.snippet: Andres Pastoriza, Minister from the Dominican Republic, said tonight that national committees had been formed in fourteen American republics to cooperate in plans for pushing to completion the construction of a Columbus Memorial Lighthouse near...
docs.lead_paragraph: Andres Pastoriza, Minister from the Dominican Republic, said tonight that national committees had been formed in fourteen American republics to cooperate in plans for pushing to completion the construction of a Columbus Memorial Lighthouse near Ciudad Trujillo.
docs.abstract: Min A Pastoriza announces formation of coms in 14 Amer republics to complete Columbus memorial lighthouse

docs.snippet: Delegates of the six countries competing in the Pan-American boxing championships, which start tomorrow-the United States, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru and Uruguaymet last night and decided to run the tournament in twelve series of ten bouts each....
docs.lead_paragraph: Delegates of the six countries competing in the Pan-American boxing championships, which start tomorrow-the United States, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru and Uruguaymet last night and decided to run the tournament in twelve series of ten bouts each. The tournament is to be completedly Nov. 11.

headline.main: 120 BOUTS SCHEDULED; Pan-American Title Boxing to Start in Buenos Aires Tonight

docs.snippet: The American Republics Line will entertain 250 shipping men and their wives with a dinner tonight on the reconditioned liner Uruguay, which will sail from New York on Saturday on her first voyage in the new service to South American ports.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Republics Line will entertain 250 shipping men and their wives with a dinner tonight on the reconditioned liner Uruguay, which will sail from New York on Saturday on her first voyage in the new service to South American ports.

headline.main: SHIP LINE TO GIVE DINNER; 250 to Be Guests Tonight on Vessel in South American Trade
